FacilityName: Northeast Missouri Grain dba POET Biorefi. - Macon

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
POET Biorefining - Macon will operate an ethanol fuel production plant located in Macon County, Missouri.  As a requirement of the Clean Air Act Amendments 112? Accidental Release of Hazardous Air Substances program, POET Biorefining - Macon completed a risk management plan (RMP) for any chemical stored on-site that will be above the reporting threshold of 10,000 pounds.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
POET Biorefining - Macon is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from hazardous substances used in the ethanol fuel production process, specifically pentane as a constituent of the natural gasoline used as the ethanol denaturant.   The denaturant is added to the ethanol to make the ethanol unfit for human consumption.  It is the policy of POET Biorefining - Macon to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  In the event of an emergency, including an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia or denaturant, it is the policy of POET Biorefining - Macon to notify the Macon County Sheriff Department and evacuate all employees at the facility.  

Regulated Substances Handled
The facility produces fuel grade ethanol from corn and a process by-product known as dry distillers grain with solubles, which is used as a livestock feed.  The fuel ethanol production process requires use of a denaturant (natural gasoline) which is reported to contain approximately 30 percent pentane, an RMP regulated substance.  The maximum amount of natural gasoline on-site is estimated to be 488,000 pounds (total pentane is 146,200 pounds).  The natural gasoline is stored in an above ground tank as a liquid and is introduced to the fuel ethanol in the final stage of production.  The denaturant tank is located in the facility's tank farm area which includes a secondary containment dike.  Anhydrous Ammonia is also stored on site and used in the ethanol production process for pH as well as in the carbon di

oxide plant as a receiving tank.  The maximum anhydrous ammonia stored onsite would be 75,000 lbs.  POET Biorefining - Macon has evaluated the worst-case and alternative case scenario as it related to this reportable substance.  Emergency response program for this scenario has been prepared and implemented.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program
Through completion of this RMP, POET Biorefining - Macon has complied with the EPA requirements under 40 CFR Part 68.  Process safety information and operations/maintenance procedures are documented on-site.  Periodic functions such as process hazard analysis, training, change management and incident investigation are conducted on a regular basis.  Audits of the overall RMP will be conducted on a regular basis to assure compliance with EPA regulations.

Five Year Accident History
POET Biorefining - Macon has NO history of accidents which may have caused death, injuries, environmental or property damage, evacuations or in-place sheltering in the last five years.
